1.2.description: Be able to explain how content is shared on IPFS

subgoals.description: Be able to describe what content identifiers and mutable data are
Understand the challenges posed in a decentralized content sharing system
Understand the basics of the public DHT
Be able to explain what a peer, node, and swarm are in the context of IPFS

1.4.description: Be able to explain the basics of data transfer in IPFS

subgoals.description: Learn what is IPFS's message-oriented protocol to exchange data
Know what are the different message types and their order of operations
Understand what is the session and the ledger in the context of Bitswap
Explain the different components of Bitswap at a high level
Discover what advantages Graphsync has over Bitswap

1.6.description: Be able to explain the basics of UnixFS

subgoals.description: Understand what is UnixFS and what problem it solves
Learn how files with more than a single block are labeled
Go over the protobuf format, and its main field
